title: About Me
text:
Hi, Iâ€™m Kashish ğŸ‘‹
Iâ€™m a Statistics student at UBC who likes working with data - cleaning it, analyzing it, building things with it, and occasionally wondering why itâ€™s broken in the first place.
Iâ€™ve spent time across data science, analytics, and data engineering, working on projects in healthcare, government, and large companies. I enjoy figuring out how data moves from raw and messy to useful and understandable.
Right now, I mostly work with Python and SQL, and spend a lot of time around tools like Airflow, Spark, dbt, Parquet, and Arrow. I like systems that are simple, reproducible, and donâ€™t surprise you at 3am.
When Iâ€™m not working with data, Iâ€™m either at the pool, catching up on sleep, or convincing myself Iâ€™ll only watch one episode.

Posts

Why Parquet + Arrow Changed Our Ingestion Pipeline

title: Why Parquet + Arrow Changed Our Ingestion Pipeline
text:
During my internship at Population Data BC, we migrated ingestion pipelines from CSV-based workflows to Apache Parquet with Arrow-backed in-memory analytics.

Key Takeaways

Columnar formats dramatically reduce I/O
Arrow enables zero-copy data sharing
Researcher productivity improved immediately

More technical deep-dive coming soon.
